relation: I never had any problems in my two years at NVC. The campus is pretty busy all the time and someone will walk with you out to your car if you just ask.
If you only take your core classes and go full time it is worth it and a great campus for the price.
Food is usually really good except the star bucks coffee. They have a lot of space to eat and a really neat Cyber cafe looking over the lake.
An easy school, you can raise your GPA here.

Take only main courses, I was told from my four year school that the community college classes like Spanish, business and Kines classes are tech classes and wont count. The classes are considered almost high school level courses to a four year program.
NVC I rate as a fair school. The campus is nice, but the adviser's are awful and don't help much at all. In fact I lost 30 hours when I transferred because I was given false information
pageTitle: Northwest Vista College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {133533=This school has a great facility, built to be both modern and a great place to study. The parking garage is underway for 2013 summer release date, and will be a much needed facet. The school is right of the highway, and depending where you live, it can be very convenient to go to., 11453=It's a community college, so you'd expect to have to pay less. it's about $1000 a semester before textbooks. But you learn so much from the classes here if you take the right ones that it's totally worth it., 401324=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Comments Great for these types of students great for any kind of student. as long as you have the dedication to do your best. Tips for prospective students The campus is growing every year, but its very nice and peaceful. The instructors are very helpful. The college also has small classes for one on one time with the instructor if you need additional help. Not to mention the computer labs that have people who specialize in the subjects you need help in. Bang for the buck Although it is a community college, you are getting what you paid for. Am learning a lot I learned a lot more than I thought I would.
